intro: Neuradopsis bechuanensis, commonly known as the Bechuanian daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Neuradopsis bechuanensis is often found in grasslands and shrublands, contributing to the floral diversity of its habitat.
